Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394722) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394722)
